definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: I am sure my opinion is both sound and well-grounded.
sentences.chinese: 我可以肯定我的看法既合情合理又有凭有据。

sentences.english: Their various adventures are exciting, but perfectly plausible .
sentences.chinese: 他们的冒险事迹真够刺激，可完全是合情合理的。

sentences.english: Both of these are really legitimate issues that you have to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 这两种假设都是合情合理的，都有必要加以解决。

sentences.english: Such a requirement, they say, is justified in an economic-stimulus package.
sentences.chinese: 他们称这样的要求在经济刺激方案中是合情合理的。

sentences.english: Your first step is to teach your child legitimate interrupting times.
sentences.chinese: 你首先要做的是，使孩子们知道合情合理的打断时段。

sentences.english: The complaint letter should be firm but reasonably worded.
sentences.chinese: 投诉信应该语气坚决并陈述合情合理。

sentences.english: In Aung San Suu Kyi, he could not have a more reasonable opponent.
sentences.chinese: 昂山素季是他能得到的最合情合理的对手。

sentences.english: Charges for the use of technology are reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 收取使用技术费是合情合理的。

sentences.english: In the pantheon of ancient gods she appears to me to be unusually reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 在古代诸神中，她的存在在我看来非常合情合理。
乍一听来，似乎合情合理。

sentences.english: “That logic is inescapable here,” Judge Cacheris wrote.
sentences.chinese: “这种逻辑是合情合理的，”法官卡察里斯写道。

definition: acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
according to reason/in the ordinary course of events/normally
